Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; great location and good value (though not cheap)”
Reviews.Author: Randl93
Reviews.Content: A local recommended staying near the Spanish steps as a good central location and after a brief search on Tripadvisor my wife and I booked Babuino for 4 nights in April. The room was very luxurious and although there wasn't a separate room for a sitting area - do you really need one? Bathroom included large bath, great shower and separate WC area. I thought it was good value for money given the size and spec of the room and its central location - you'd pay twice as much for the equivalent in central London. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and had a seemingly endless list of restaurant recommendations. We didn't have a single bad meal and again I was pleasantly surprised by the prices. A very fancy five course tasting menu at "Life" on Via Vita (lobster and the full works) including five glasses of wine each came to 130 Euros for two. Maybe I'm too used to the prices in London but I thought that was good value. Beware of the shops. They are superb - that's where you'll overspend!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: europe_travel_lovers
Reviews.Content: This all suites property is terrific. We stayed over spring (Easter) break: -Classic suite: Not really a suite but a large triple (no separate room). However large modern bathroom with a big tub, rainfall shower stall and separate toilet area. -Great soundproofing and good 'air' -Breakfast is delivered to your room, and very generous. Continental or American (includes meat/cheeses). Comes quickly (under 10 minutes). -Very nice and knowledgeable staff. Great restaurant recommentations (Pietro, Edy, and Buci da Ripetta. Il Brillo) all within walking distance. Only one BAD recommendation Gusto (don't go!!!!). Loud, more expensive than the others recommended, so so food, and the waiter ripped us off by insisting service was not included and he needed an extra tip in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline D
Reviews.Content: A little expensive but worth it. Comfortable, good facilities. Beautiful Rome! I hope to return ...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel with many lovely touches”
Reviews.Author: Clanna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in easy reach of many of the attractions. We were in Rome for the rugby at Stadio Olympique. The hotel staff were very helpful, the rooms big and airy and the shower / bathroom large with a powerful shower. Free coffee both in the room and in the lounge with complimentary pastries. The wifi had a strong signal and was complimentary ----- a pleasant and forward looking policy! Definitely one of the best hotels we have stayed in and will return to.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhound
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Rome and where to stay? After a great deal of research I took the plunge and book Babuino 181 because it looked well located and good value for money and, of course, it has been well reviewed on here! I am pleased to say that it was a good decision. As other reviewers have said this is not a 'full service' hotel simply an elegant selection of rooms and suites conveniently situated on a high end shopping street between two metro stations (Flaminio and Spagna) and 50 yards from a taxi rank. We were well greeted on arrival and shown to our room. A good sized deluxe room with a well appointed bathroom that had a big deep bath and boy, was I pleased to sink into that bath after a hard day pounding the pavements of Rome! My only word of caution is that the bath is quite low down and the door to the shower very narrow so if you are someone on the larger side you may find using these facilities a little difficult. The toiletries provided are good quality and plentiful with lovely big bars of soap not the slivers that are the norm in most hotels. The front of house staff were very helpful. They recommended Edy's a very local trattoria for our evening meal. I am pleased to say it was only five minute walk for my tired legs and we enjoyed a fairly simple but pleasant enough meal that was reasonably priced. Breakfast was included in our room rate. It came on a tray to our room. We ordered the 'healthy' breakfast and the 'continental' breakfast and it was more than enough for us. We had fabulous fresh orange juice, fresh fruit and cereal as well as a good selection of pastries and coffee. All in all we had a very comfortable stay. On our last day they looked after our luggage and we were able to take advantage of coffee and biscuits in their small first floor lounge whilst we freshened up for our journey home. Thank you Babuino 181 we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 night stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RishiKhanna
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a place. We had a deluxe suite 50 sq meters. I think this was one of the best rooms from my travels in Europe. Here is why 1. Excellent bathroom- two sinks - a great tub (yes I used it) and a spacious shower cubicle. The WC area is not cramped behind a door as one often sees in Europe. Better than the pics on the website show you. Airy and spacious and the styling is really excellent - contemporary chic, earthy colors - lovely mosaic on the wall. Great toilet amenities and enough robes/towels - (the weighing scale was innacurate though !) 2. Spacious and comfortable room - very cleverly designed. Enough wardrobe space - including hanging space and drawers. And great place for keeping your suitcases (we had 2 large ones and one small) - not the clumsy racks you get at most hotels. Overall for the comfort, elegance, space and design - I would give this room 10/10 3. Location - right next to Piazza Del Poppolo is wonderful. So many bars, restaurants, shops around that you will never miss the common areas which a more traditional hotel has, but this does not (It does have one nice room one can use if one wishes) 4. Front Desk Staff: They were friendly and efficient and more than willing to help. They arranged 2 lovely tours for us on short notice (Vatican and Ancient Rome). And also made restaurant recomendations and reservations. The drop off to the airport - S class merceded for 60 Euros is also a lovely idea. In fact they had been in touch with us immediately after we had booked and were very helpful and responsive. 5. Breakfast in bed - thats great - i love it. why would you want to go down for breakfast when you can get it in bed. Having said that the breakfast selection is limited. Also a wonderful surprise - our minibar was included in our rate - we didn't pay for our water and cookies/chips A word of clarification: As you would have seen in the other reviews this is not a classic hotel with a big lobby or tons of staff to fuss over you. The space is top class - stylish and better than what you would see at the top hotels. But there are no substantial common areas. I was apprehensive about this but after having stayed there I can say with confidence that given the location and all it has to offer as soon as you walk out the door - I don't think anyone would miss these common areas. I would also like to add that in Rome you see a lot of rich/classical architechture/art all around you. So having a hotel room which is contemporary in its styling offers relief. In fact I believe that the contemporary style of the hotel offers itself to be juxtaposed with the more traditional styles one sees in the city, and this actually helps you appreciate the latter even more. This is a subtle but in my view important point. I also think that overall it is better to stay in this area rather than in the veneto area which is above the steps (Spanish Steps). Most of the grand old hotels are in the Via Veneto area which is a bit "dull" in my view compared to the streets below the steps. Finally don't miss Pincio garden just minutes away- its a wonderful place to relax and get some open space Keep it up Babuino !!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnHenryH
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the same floor for ourselves and two adult children. we were able to get one room early as we arrived around lunch time, was appreciated. we were shown to our room and bags were handled well. The rooms were great. Modern and spacious. Nice windows and good light. Location perfect. Staff friendly and helpful. We did not take breakfast in the hotel so no comment. Internet worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and then some.”
Reviews.Author: Domhnachdaoi
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Pleasant helpful staff. Felt like a home from home. Would stay again if in Roma. 5 stars - not given lightly !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SH2012
Reviews.Content: Babuino is in the upmarket Tridente district (a perfect area for shopping) 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps, a short walk from Villa Borghese and only 22km from Rome Fiumicino Airport. We stayed at Babuino 181 for 3 nights in August 2011, whilst in Rome for a wedding, the suites are spacious, comfortable and our room at the back of the hotel was surprisingly quiet given the central location. The room was equipped with a Nespresso machine, a good sized bathroom, plenty of wardrobe space & excellent air conditioning - an essential in 40 degree heat! There's no restaurant or bar but breakfast was brought to our room & the very friendly concierge were happy to recommend local restaurants. Transport from the hotel is easy as Piazza di Popolo is 2 minutes walk from the hotel & has a large taxi rank. The only downside was that a late check-out wasn't possible (even though we had requested it weeks before our arrival) but the concierge were accommodating & let us use the lounge after check-out.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jkyl
Reviews.Content: simply put, if you like discreet luxury, take pleasure in the tiniest details, excellent design, and warm, professional staff, you will LOVE this place! why i loved the place: 1. central, yet discreet: a 5 minute walk from the Spanish steps, 10ish to the Trevi Fountain, and you can walk to the Vatican in about 20-25. With Babuino, there is no outward flashiness - its a discreet entry on a snazzy street, like the entry to your exclusive apartment. the service is also discreet. breakfast to your door, a traditional breakfast or fruits, muesli and yoghurt (quite filling - they'll send croissants as well, if you want) if you prefer. freshly squeezed orange juice, certainly didn't taste like stuff out of a can. 2. impeccable design and still cosy: the rooms are fabulous. we had 202, one of their suites, and it was absolutely lovely. every detail, from the lighting, the stylish lamps, generous walk-in closet, personal nespresso machine, the enormous (and very comfortable) 4-poster bed, even the window shutters, are immaculate. the bathroom is the size of most rooms, a tub you actually want to lie in, or the 'rainfall' shower. if you want the big marble hotel lobby, this may not be for you. but if you want your own cozy, snazzy apartment for a few days as you explore Rome, and want to look forward to coming back to your room every day, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, fixed problems immediately, great location! The place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Pikotw888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Babuino 181 with my Wife for our Chinese new year holiday for 2012. We stayed for 4 night and 3 days. On the first night when we arrived the concierge reccomended us a local restaurant to eat, it was great and after a long day's travel gave us a wonderful first impression of Italy. When we returned to our Room the TV was not working, so I called the concierge they repaired the fault within 20 minutes, however after the repair during the night the Sky box that was fixed fell from its mounting onto the desk below the tv hitting the top lid of my apple MacBook and cracking the screen. After a quick discussion with the concierge in the morning I was surprised when the very friendly manager turned up almost immediately and took my laptop for repair! Within 24 hours they had taken my laptop to repair at Apple Rome and replaced the screen. I was impressed to say the least and now I understand why they are number 4 on trip advisor. In my opinion they should be number 1. Breakfast was included in our room, and when my wife wanted a banana which didn't come with the Anerican Breakfast the hotel brought us a entire fruit basket! On leaving the hotel the hotel arranged a Mercedes car service for us at a very reasonable price, I checked several local taxi providers and €60 was very reasonable, as a regular taxi probably would have cost the same because we left at rush hour to the airport. In all I cannot fault this hotel. Next time in Rome I will stay again. Thanking you for the great stay and fantastic service. Paul Singleton

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: john r
Reviews.Content: I've been there last november with my wife and it was a good experience, the room was large and it was very clean, it was only a little bit too noisy! Breakfast was served in the room every morning, it was not a big breakfast but still good!! Then, great location, great room, good breakfast, noisy sleep, high price!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gabymassiel
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has outstanding service, great breakfast and it is very clean the main atractive is the excellent location near major atractions and the metro, they will go out of their way to help you if you need; I would highly recomend it. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Stay nowhere else in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: coloradoDenver
Reviews.Content: Stay nowhere else in Rome. My family stayed here for 10 great nights in two rooms from January 2 to 12th. Chose hotel based on reviews and we were not sorry. Restaurants are everywhere and the staff will make recommendations and reservations for you, just ask. Very convenient to shopping in Spanish steps area, and yet walkable to the Vatican if you choose. Coliseum probably a bit too far. Nice thing is you are next to Piazza di Popolo which is a major taxi stand so getting to and from hotel area is easy. Rooms in the hotel are very comfortable. Yes there is street noise for those who overlook Via Babunio, but between 9pm and 7am it is pretty quiet, no problem sleeping. Nice to watch the street life in the morning on via Babuino. Courtyard rooms are completely quiet. Breakfasts are served in your room, which is nice because you can take your time getting ready while eating. The staff is happy to adjust your breakfast food selections to your needs (I asked for more oranges and I think they must have been picking them off the trees every morning…wow). Just to mention the Sky TV, since my son figured this out toward the end of our stay. There is a button on the controller that allows to you view the US programs in English rather than Italian). My sincere thanks to all the staff that made it a great visit for my wife and two boys. We hope to return very soon to a great hotel and town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MatthewPCarvalho
Reviews.Content: We looked into several hotels to stay at when we made the decision to go to Rome. We had read the reviews and decided that this was the one, and we clearly made the right decision. We stayed at 6 hotels in total on this trip which included 2 x Sofitel’s, Westin, Le Meridian, and a Four Seasons. This hotel was hands down the best value. The free Wi-Fi, the location, the breakfast, the minibar were all terrific. Many hotels take advantage of its customers by ripping them off with charging 80-100 euros for breakfast, 10 euros for a coffee and 20-25 euros for internet access for a day. My partner was unfortunately sick for one of the 3 days and the staff there was very caring and checked in constantly to make sure she was ok and if we needed anything. On departure they were kindly removed any minibar purchases from our bill as they were genuinely upset for my partner that she had to waste a day in Rome being in bed. It wasn’t even their fault either!! The reception staff were very good and knew all the best places to eat, and not the most expensive restaurants like every other hotel seemed to recommend!!! The room was fantastic and location was right in the middle of all the action. Couldn’t have asked for a place to stay. I would certainly recommend this small hotel to anyone visiting Rome. It was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service, location and quality”
Reviews.Author: bmfeeley
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas week, family of 4 (kids 10 & 20yrs old) and had excellent time. Two connecting suites really made life easier. Staff assisted very well with all our needs, requests. Location is premier. Rooms on the courtyard are absolutely quite, those on street facing can be louder, but are more interesting since windows open and you can partake of the lively streetlife. Brian and family, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: SvenGerlach
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with the room, service and location and would recommend the hotel to all our friends. The only recommendation we would give to the hotel is to encourage their concierges to be more forthcoming with tourist and sightseeing related information and arrangements. This includes information on which tourist guides to use for the vatican city, where to book tickets for the collosseum to avoid queues and which restaurants to go to.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back! Had a great stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruvis S
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 day vacation, the hotel staff was very helpful and welcoming and helped us in everything we asked for, the location was great and the rooms are very very good! Ruvi and Adina, Israel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room and services”
Reviews.Author: Santa_Maria_Japone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at classic suite for three nights in Christmas season. The bathroom was roomy, comfortable and clean. Tha bathtub has enough length and depth so we could stretch the legs and bodies and release tireness after all the walking of a day. One thing that needs improvement though was the door of the shower room. I don't know if it was because the door was too loose or the floor was not flatten, the water leaked to the outside and we had to get a few towels to wipe it off. Nice, healthy breakfast, friendly service, and clean housekeeping. Overall, our stay was very comfortable. We would definitely come back again next time in Rome. Lastly, they do have good recommendation for restaurants, so please ask if they are not on your itinerary!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: p3ng
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying 3 nights at this hotel last week to celebrate my birthday. - ROOM: We were welcomed with a free upgrade to the Babuino Suite upon arrival, which was amazing! It's located on the 3rd floor, and doesn't face the main street. It has a private balcony, overlooking a quiet sidestreet, but shame really, as it was a bit cold to use! There was also a spacious living/dining area, an elegant bedroom, a well stocked bathroom, and a separate toilet. For European standards, the suite was huge, and being fairly high in the building, there was plenty of natural light. - EATING: Tea and coffee facilities are complimentary in the suite, and for coffee fans, there's a Nespresso machine. Snacks are available for a price. Breakfast is served in the room, and all you need to do is call reception and they'll bring it up in 10-15mins. There were a choice of 4 menus: diet, American, continental, and children's. Regardless of the menu you choose, it was a nice and varied selection of food; could have been a tad better with less prepackaged items, but it was substantial enough to last us a good number of hours. Complimentary tea, coffee, and cookies are also available in the lobby on the first floor. For restaurant suggestions/bookings, ask the concierge and they will happily help. Babette and Edy are literally on the sidestreets across the road - one left, one right, respectively. Both were great, but personally, my favourite was Babette (great service, great food). - LOCATION: Perfectly located in every way! The street it's on is called Via del Babuino, which is Rome's answer to London's Bond Street, and likewise, the Oxford and Regent Street equivalents are adjacent. My boyfriend and I walked to all our sights: + Piazza del Popolo is literally to the left of the hotel - a nice square to while your time away. + Turn right and the Spanish Steps are a mere 5mins' walk. + Vatican City took approx 20mins to get to because we wanted to walk along the river and cross the Bridge of Angels, but there were quicker routes via the more ordinary bridges. + Colosseum took no more than 30mins. - CONCLUSION: I loved my stay.. and I love Rome. Service was faultless and the location was fantastic. Every evening, I felt as though I was going back to my own apartment, and that can be quite hard to come by. IF I had to nitpick, then.. + Breakfasts could be more exciting. + The bath salts didn't get replenished on our last evening.. + Would have been easier viewing if the living area's TV was adjustable (i.e. rotatable). + Though it didn't really bother us as a couple, the spare toilet's door lock is faulty (forgot to mention to staff, sorry!). Other than that, it was a nigh on perfect stay. Would I recommend? Wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: leonard k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Rome November 20th for a 4 night stay, before we were to board a cruise ship which would return us to the United States. Within hours, my wife had been bumped off the sidewalk landing on the left side of her face on the cobblestone street. Our cruise was cancelled and four nights at Babuino became sixteen. Two days in a public hospital were followed by five in a private clinic, including surgery on her eye. The hotel, and in particular, the entire staff of the Babuino, were phenomenal. They turned a nightmare into as pleasant a stay as possible. Everyone was so attentive, accomodating and caring that we were able to relax and my wife begin to heal for the seven days after surgery. The hotel location is great and the property and people fntastic.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmalibu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel last week. The location is fantastic and the staff was attentive and helpful. I am a writer/.producer TV travel programs and my husband is the former President of the Los Angeles Covention Center Authority. We are very particular where we stay when traveling. The hotel is building a roof top bar/lounge area with a view over the surrounding historic area. There are several great local restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel. The rooms are modern, clean and excellent bath and hair products. Cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A sensational boutique hotel in a brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: 12coco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in late November and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in one of their smaller rooms, however, this room was not small, it was very, very spacious. We certainly had plenty of room, including a very large wardrobe and an enormous bathroom. Breakfast was not included in our room rate so I can't comment on that but the location was so central that we were able to find many beautiful cafes for breakfast, including a couple in Piazza del Popolo. The hotel is very small, only about 14 rooms, but the service is outstanding. Each night we were given the names of 1 or 2 local restaurants, away from the tourists, to try for dinner and every recommendation was just superb. We were on one of the lower floors and we had no issue with noise at all. We did walk to all of the sites including the Vatican, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon etc with no trouble at all. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate even for those who usually stay at five star hotels.”
Reviews.Author: celebrationtiger
Reviews.Content: Babuino 181 has a great location. As a hotel with 14 rooms and no lobby it is none the less a very pleasant spot. The rooms are very modern and well appointed but the view and noise from our two windows was quite unpleasant. Room 102 is not a good choice as it looks out on a alley which is used an outdoor noisy café. It may not be so bad in the winter. The television had very few of the typical English language stations we have come to expect. The gentleman at the front desk were uniformly helpful and their car service for 60 euros from the airport an excellent idea. The breakfast could be improved by a plain croissant instead of only sweet ones. The bread was commercial and poor . The fresh orange juice was very full of pulp.The Philadelphia cream cheese felt a little out of place without a bagel. There are so many good Italian cheeses American ones are not needed. The restaurant Eddy was recommended . It was pleasant , close by and reasonably priced. The best restaurant we found was the Trattoria del Pantheon da Fortunato off the square near the Pantheon. The fish was excellent and the service perfect. The atmoshere was very pleasant and from the pictures on the walls it appears to attract politicians from many nations.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Dave_20
Reviews.Content: I surprised my girlfriend (now fiance after this trip!) with 2 nights here. We had a Deluxe Suite which was amazing - very spacious, really comfy bed, huge TV with Sky (although most of channels Italian), big bathroom with separate shower and bath and 2 sinks. Service was great - all staff really friendly and helpful. Never stayed in a hotel that offers a 'turn down' service! Photos on the hotel website don't really do it justice - it looks even better when you see it. Location of hotel is perfect. It might look a bit far North on a map but we got round all the sights on foot. It's about a half hour walk to the colosseum or Vatican city with plenty of things to look at on the way. Comfy shoes are a good idea. Some people have mentioned the street noise but we didn't really notice it. The windows have shutters on the outside and inside, we only closed the inside ones and it was quiet enough. Breakfast is served in your room and you have a choice of diet, continental or American. We had continental one day and American the other. Both were pretty similar and both really nice. Kept us going until lunch time. The hotel recommended a nearby restaurant 'Edy'. Food was good, but service very laid back, and being a small restaurant on a Saturday night meant it was very busy and we had to wait a long time for the food. Don't let that put you off though. We also think it's worthwile having the hotel arrange a taxi. It's more expensive (€60) than getting a local taxi (€40 I think) or the train then tube, but you get picked up by a smart driver in a posh Mercedes and the experience of being whizzed through the centre of Rome is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandra s
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 days in this lovely boutique hotel. Superb location, excellent service, very modern and comfortable.Enjoyed also the fact, that you will get served the breakfast in your room. That perfect.Definitely one of the best places to stay when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Via del Babuino is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AleenBeirut
Reviews.Content: Although our visit to Rome was not the first, this time it had a very different taste. We decided to stay at the Babuino Hotel based on the reviews we had read about it, and it was a very good choice to make! Thanks to its perfect location, we had a very easy access to all the historic places in downtown Rome; Piazza di Spagna was only five minutes away from us! We could enjoy Rome that doesn’t sleep without being bothered by the noise!. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and remained so for the whole duration of our stay. The sheets and the towels were of exquisite quality! The staff were so helpful and professional but also very friendly. The manager Mr Assem was very attentive to all our requests and he was also very keen to suggest to us the best restaurants to eat and the best places to shop. For your next visit to Rome, Via del Babuino is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in the center of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Nomadicluxury
Reviews.Content: After trying out a few other hotels on a recent trip to Rome I finally found the hotel Babuino and I am very happy that I did. The location is excellent, the staff were all genuinely helpful and accommodating and the rooms were very nice. The room interior was well designed and comfortable, the wifi network was speedy and the walk-in closet was perfect for two. The bathroom was large and nicely appointed as well. There was a nice common area that resembled a small living room outside the entrance to the rooms for the guests to relax in. They had a nice selection of magazines, a copy of the Herald Tribune everyday and some nice local biscuits to snack on too. I will definitely stay here the next time I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: PNeary
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on trip advisor, booked this hotel for the weekend. The other reviews accurately reflect the place. We had room 101 on the first floor, the room is very well appointed, it is on par with a good 4 star hotel. I note that other reviewers stated that it can be noisy with noise filtering up from the street and you can hear other guests walking above you. This is True, but this is rome,it is a big city, the original bulidings are old, it did not bother us that much. The detail in the room is of the highest standard the beds are very comfortable, bathroom, spacious with good shower and large tub. The ipod docking station and nesprsso machine are a nice touch. The location of the hotel is excellent, just a 5 minute stroll from the spanish steps, the high end stores are all located on the same road as the hotel. The staff were very helpful with booking restaurants and taxi's etc. Checkout a local restaurant called "eddy's?" just around the corner from the hotel would reccomend for lunch. We would saty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great staff, but some street noise”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_Chris
Reviews.Content: This is a small (14 room) beautifully appointed hotel with really helpful and friendly staff. The location couldn't be better, though here lies the only potential problem - some street noise at night. Though we had been drinking and that might have been part of the problem! This small group has two other hotels in the same area which look equally attractive. Continental breakfast brought to your room (there is no restaurant though they are constructing a small rooftop space for this now) was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: mayyouch
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and we couldn't have been happier with our choice! The location of the hotel is perfect, within walking distance from many of Rome's most important sites. The check-in process was as smooth as possible and the room was spacious, elegant and extremely clean (and remained so for the rest of our stay). Breakfast was delivered within minutes from ordering it and always had exactly what we asked for. This hotel's strongest asset is its employees who were simply amazing in every way. They catered to our every need and exceeded our expectations every time. Special thanks to Assem who made our stay extra special! If you're looking for a no-fuss no-nonsense hotel in the center of Rome, with some of the biggest rooms you'll find in Europe and a team of professional staff who will be more than happy to help you in any possible way, then try Babuino 181.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull spot in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Eriksen90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just around the corner of Piazza del Poppolo (and just across the street from hotel Russie) - I have been to Rome several time and can not think of a better place to stay. We stayed in room 302 a very spacius suite with a lovely terrace. The interiur is elegant and tastefull. Bathroom also spacius with seperate shower and bathtub. The suite also has an extra toilet for guests. The hotel offers a professionel and personal service - with a charming smile. Breakfast was served in our room just a few minuttes after calling the reception. It was indeed a pleasure to stay in Babuino 181.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kariann F
Reviews.Content: Babuino 181 is located very close to the Spanish Stairs. We walked to all the important Rome attractions, including the Vatican. The service was excellent. Bennedetto was especially helpful to us with directions and restaurant recommendations. The hotel was brand new and immaculate. Each room had a soaking tub and a rain shower. Each room also had a cappuccino/espresso machine. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, right amongst it”
Reviews.Author: thedorts
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights with my family. great design and a fantastic location. wonderful people working there, especially Andrea. will be back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer V
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this place to us. It was conveniently located, staff was very friendly, accommodations were comfortable ---just what we needed after a long day. The only issue we had on this trip (which I don't think was the staff's fault) was that we had booked a tour that included a car and driver at our disposal for that day. Lo and behold, the guide arrived with no car, no driver. They put us in two taxis since we were a family of six. We didn't get any discount, no refund and instead, still paid the same amount. Another thing, the places that were indicated were not the places we went to. THey gave us a detailed tour of the Forum and Colosseo bec there wasn't a car and driver at our disposal so we stayed in the sights that were close to each other. When you have them book a tour, make sure things are clarified. If not for this, our stay would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best of New and Old in Rome”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: Babuino 181 is a great example of new and old coming together in a fantastic hotel experience. The hotel captures all the romance and history of Rome in a great location, but in a modern, clean and spacious rooms with free WiFi. The Frette sheets and huge state of the art bathrooms are the deal sealers. If you've had enough of overly priced, tired and somewhat dirty closet-sized hotel rooms in Rome then stop by 181 and have a look. It's a luxurious experience and a great value for your Euro.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: esther k
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this beautiful hotel in the center of Rome. A lot of restaurants and shops are just a few steps away. The rooms are very nice and very well equipped with a big bathroom and also a big wardrobe.Tea and coffee is included in the rooms. Breakfast can be ordered in the morning as room sevice.The Staff was extremely helpful and nice. Andrea helped us with a lot of very useful advices for restaurants and sightseeing. We enjoyed our stay very much - and the staff in this Hotel makes it just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regina N
Reviews.Content: Four nights stay was not enough! The suites are truly luxurious especially for Roman standards. We have been to Rome many times and this hotel was the best find yet. The perfect location and the great, friendly staff made our holiday wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay & superb concierge Andrea!”
Reviews.Author: Wendymuz
Reviews.Content: We booked the apartment through Mr & Mrs Smith and found it to be perfect. Location is fabulous for doing all of Rome's sightseeing but is nice and quiet in the evening. Room was fantastic but what really make this place is Andrea the concierge. She booked lovely restaurants for us each evening and gave great advice on what to do and when. She basically looked after us well and is a star!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique experience in a fantastic neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: GroAnd
Reviews.Content: We splurged on Babuino 181 for the last 2 nights of our 10 day Florence/Tuscan countryside/Rome vacation and couldn't have been more pleased. From the moment you enter the hotel you are treated like a special guest of an exclusive establishment. Rooms are beautiful- bathroom is great (although the shower stall does leak onto the floor a bit)....coffee maker in the room was a plus and it made amazing espresso and coffee lungo...bed was comfortable...full walk in closet...deep tub for a soak with bath salts...upscale neighborhood which is lively but not jam-packed with tourists which we loved.. they even lent me a small laptop to check my emails....evenings are very quiet....some reviewers complain it's not near the sights, but the joy of Rome is to be had in the walking..we walked from the hotel to The Colosseum and it took about 20 minutes....a wonderful end to our lovely trip to Italia..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable B&B”
Reviews.Author: HopingThisHelps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on recommendations from various guides and its high rating on Tripadvisor. The service is great, as described by other Tripadvisor members, and the rooms actually look much better than in the candids on this site. The B&B is in a very good location close to the Spanish Steps but a bit away from the crowds, which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SlickWilliam
Reviews.Content: We loved the room, location and staff at Babuino 181. The location near Piazza del Popolo is fantastic as there are many great restaurants (Babette, il Brillo Parlente, il Gabriella, and Ad Hoc) within walking distance. The hotel has great rooms that are nicely decorated and large. We stayed in Room 205 which is located on Via Babuino and has the only balcony overlooking the street and Piazza del Popolo. The room is wonderful and worth a request. It has a huge bathroom with separate tub and shower, dual sinks and a private toilet/bidet room. Complimentary continental breakfast is brought to your room and the Concierge's (Andrea in particular) were very helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. There is a great deck area on the rooftop level which is currently being renovated into a bar/kitchen. It will make a nice addition to an already perfect property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate F
Reviews.Content: Our room at Babuino 181 was beautiful - well designed, highly functional, quiet. It was a fantastic respite from the heat and hustle bustle of Rome. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast (served in room) was a typical continental spread. My only suggestion to the hotel is that they serve each person's breakfast on an individual tray - we couldn't juggle everything on the single tray.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: MeiRong369
Reviews.Content: great location for shopping, food and taxis staff were generally friendly and helpful full selection of cable channels (unlike many other hotels in Italy)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, very stylish boutique hotel and staff that go out of their way to be helpful!a”
Reviews.Author: Carole C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Babuino 181 for 3 nights from 7th - 10th September. (Our friends also stayed at the hotel but they liked it so much they're writing their own review!) Our stay should have commenced one night earlier on the 6th but an Italian strike delayed our arrival. When the hotel heard of our plight they went out of their way to accommodate our needs, explaining what they were able to offer us to make sure we had the very best stay possible! Andrea, the Guest Relations Manager, Vincenzo and Benedetto are just three examples of the hotel's courteous and extremely helpful members of staff. Because of our delayed arrival we had to change our room for our final night's stay...... OMG the Babuino Suite is awesome! The whole hotel oozes understated style and attention to detail, I would definitely stay there again given the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “we absolutely loved it and recommend it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: abcdefgsmith
Reviews.Content: we came to rome on our 25th wedding anniversary and searched forever to find a great hotel in rome. A friend of ours also searched for us and recommended this hotel. from the location close to the spanish steps and the wonderful shopping just outside the door, this hotel was absolutely fantastic. We loved the staff who were so personable, helpful and professional. we loved the room which was so tastefully decorated and a good size. If you are looking for class, hospitality, a new and fresh hotel located near the best shops and restaurants and right in the heart of the best atmosphere in rome, then look no further than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but imperfect”
Reviews.Author: Foma
Reviews.Content: I'll never understand how hotels determine what room(s) hotel guests will stay in. We typically book two rooms and always ask for either an adjoining room if possible, or at least rooms in close proximity ( e.g., next to each other, across the hall). I can't tell you the number of times when we get to the hotel we are not even on the same floor. Such was the case for Babuino 181, one room on Floor 1 one on Floor 2. Now having said that, the hotel is small and the distance was not great, but there was a lot of running up and down stairs. This leads to one of the imperfections of Babuino 181, the front desk. After apologies about not having us together and after we were settled in and unpacked, the front desk informed us that we could be accommodated with rooms that could be made adjoining and that one of the rooms would be an upgrade at no extra charge. However, construction was going on outside the rooms. We thanked them and declined. Now let's start at the beginning. When our driver pulled up to the hotel and told us we were here, we looked around and said "we are? where?" He then pointed and said "there." That is how unassuming the entrance to the hotel is. No large signs just a small designation to the front doors. You walk into a small, modern reception area. A small glass elevator at the back and stairs encircling it. Reception was pleasant, but a little confused, though that may have been due to language differences. The rooms were lovely and modern and relatively spacious. The bathrooms were definitely roomy. The second floor room faced the street, but the sound was blocked nicely. The first floor room faced a small side-street with restaurants, but outside noise levels were more pronounced, which is probably to be expected. There is no restaurant on the premises, but the hotel provided us with a nice breakfast on our request as we had an early morning tour set up. As far as location, it can't be beat. High end shops lined Via Babuino, and we were just up the street from the Spanish Steps. Most sights were within easy walking distance and though we took a taxi to the Vatican we were able to walk home with little trouble. Another thing to recommend Babuino 181 (and I regret that I can not remember her name) is the woman at the front desk who hails from Croatia. Extremely helpful with tips for dining and gelato and places to go and providing a warm smile and lovely conversation. Now on a negative note we had issue with house cleaning and some missing personal items. Apparently, "Do Not Disturb" signs do not pertain to house cleaning. We had run out in the morning to get a quick bite to eat and then prepare for our days touring. Both of our rooms had Do Not Disturb signs displayed and when we returned both rooms were being serviced. So we had to wait for them to finish before we could continue on plus we had personal items out that normally we would have put away or placed in the room safe. As it happens we later discovered that some of my daughter's personal items were missing. The two confused men at the front desk (those who checked us in with difficulty) weren't sure what to do and told us that house cleaning didn't arrive until 8 the next morning. We offered to go through the laundry, thinking that the items were scooped up with the sheets, ourselves, but were told that wasn't necessary that they would do it. After a nervous, sleepless night, house cleaning arrived and the items were found. Another thing we were not informed of by the front desk was that croissant's and muffins and a daily newspaper were provided free of charge in a small lounge off the first floor. This certainly would have saved us a very expensive breakfast at a nearby cafe. As you can see there are some glitches that still need to be worked out. Once that is done this will be a truly great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: WallStreet10005
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here the last week of August for a quick visit to Rome before heading south to the Amalfi Coast. For our short stay, it was perfect. The staff was super friendly and helpful, particularly in helping make dinner reservations around town. Our room was spacious and well-appointed and surprisingly, quiet, even though it faced the street. We love the intimacy of a small hotel, so we didn't quite care that there wasn't a restaurant. The in room n'espresso machines were great, especially for our jet lag. However, the best feature of the hotel is it's location - an easy walk to anywhere in the city. Across the street is the hotel Russie, which has a lovely garden for drinks and around the corner, a wonderful family restaurant, Il Brillo Parlante, is just steps away. We loved staying here and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Book here! You will love it”
Reviews.Author: hilmel
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely delighted with our choice to stay at Babuino 181. The rooms are beautifully decorated in a contemporary style, amazingly comfortable and clean, with all the amenites you could want. We had 2 rooms, a classic suite for our 3 teenage children, and a deluxe double for my husband and I, both huge rooms, great bathrooms with good water pressure and fast wifi. The hotel position is terrific, a short walk from the Spanish Steps, and walking distance from the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Andrea, on reception, was fantastic greeted us with such warmth and professionalism, but went the extra distance for us every time. My son had blocked ears that needed attention before flying, and she gave us the option of calling a doctor to the hotel, or visiting the local hospital which was a free visit. We opted for the doctor, but appreciated that she didnt just blithely book a 150euro visit without concern. The roof top terrace had opened just that week, and we loved sitting in the roof tops of Rome enjoying the warmth and atmosphere. There was a lounge area outside our room which was replenished daily with water, cakes or croissants, to be enjoyed free of charge at your leisure. The rooms also have Nespresso machines. There are great restaraunts 100m from the hotel, and do not miss the best manicure and spa salon in Rome, Emanuela at Halo's www.halos.roma.it. Andrea recommended them, and it was brilliant! Lastly, we got the hotel to prebook our Colesseum underground tour tickets 30days beforw arriving in Rome, this saved us about 4 hours of queueing, do it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff and Outstanding rooms! A gem luxury, boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: josephfmessinaDOTcom
Reviews.Content: Rome is not one of my favorite cities to visit in Italy as it is often a challenge to find a great hotel with value in the city center. Also, most hotels have their hand out to collect 'extra' charges for services/amenities that should be included, but Babuino 181 does not treat their guests like this. First, the hotel is a few blocks from the Spanish Steps and within walking distance to the fine shops on Babuino. The nearest metro station is by the Spanish Steps and a cab ride from Roma Termini is around euro 15. In other words, the location is great! Our room was a deluxe room and it was large compared to other sized rooms I have stayed in Europe/Italy, which is 3+ trips/year. The bedroom was spacious and beautifully decorated, especially the inverted tray ceiling. The room was sound insulated and had great shades to block out the morning sun to sleep in. The bathroom was huge and had a great walk-in shower and large bathtub. Finally, the art work was beautiful and the room just 'flowed' as the design and color coordination was speculator. Fine extras was free WiFi, which is rare these days in upscale boutique hotels, but this is included in your rate. The unlimited Nespresso machine was a nice luxury touch. The front door staff was genuine, warm and friendly. As my girlfriend has gluten allergy, I did not have breakfast at the hotel. I will recommend Babuino 181 to family/friends in the future and when I return to Rome in the off-season (winter-to avoid the throngs of tourists) plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Modern find”
Reviews.Author: KBologna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in various places in Rome before but this Babuino 181 is probably one of the best. The service is great. All the front desk staff are helpful, from getting you a taxi to reccommending a place to eat or drink. One staff actually suggested us a restaurant where he went with his wife for their anniversary and indeed it was good. The room is spacious enough although there is no view. However, given it's right by the Spanish steps, it's better than bei g far away from action. I actually find the modern decor very pleasant as so e of the more traditional hotels may look quite nice on Internet but I find them a bit stuffy after a couple of night stays.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Suites in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MLehmanEsq
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful nights here before starting a cruise in Civitavecchia and Babuino 181 proved to be one of my favorite hotels/B&B's in Italy. First and foremost the rooms are truly fantastic. Definitely large by Rome standards and designed with such skill and taste. We loved the spacious classy bathroom, warm woods, soft intricate lighting and especially the double pane windows and good soundproofing. Our room was a perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle and heat of Rome in the summer. Which brings me to the location - which is perfect. We've enjoyed staying near the Spanish Steps before but in that locale you're inundated with tourists day and night. The Babuino is still nearby and refreshingly close to the Piazza del Pololo which is a great meeting place in its own right, but when you leave the hotel you're not confronted with hordes of tourists every which way you turn. Moreover, the area is wonderfully chic with many of the latest small boutiques and restaurants within a few blocks. We really loved the area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and accommodated us in more ways than we could have asked. The only downside, if there is one, is the lack of any breakfast area and the availability of only a continental style breakfast. Although very good, we would have preferred a bit more choice and even a small room outside of your suite to eat breakfast. We had friends staying at the St. Regis and when they visited our room, the immediately wanted to change to our hotel. That says alot about the Babuiino. It's a great stylish classy boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HollisJD
Reviews.Content: One characteristic seldom mentioned in Roman hotel rooms is space. Babuino 181, however, has plenty of it. You wouldn't think it from the humble facade and the petite entry and elevator, but the room we had (303) was large - even by US standards. The bathroom was completely renovated and well appointed. Also, important to note is the great AC. Since visiting Europe, we've realized that US air conditioning and EU air conditioning should not be considered equal. Babuino 181 knows what US A/C is all about, which is really important in August in Rome. A few other nice features included the innovative door locks, lighting system and in-room coffee maker - a must have for caffeine addicts like myself. Plus, Babuino is in the perfect location for shopping and seeing some of Rome's most beautiful places: Gucci, Fendi, Ferragamo. But seriously, there are great restaurants in this area and finding a cab takes just walking half a block to Piazza del Popolo. More importantly, getting a cab back only requires you tell your Italian cabbie "Piazza del Popolo, which always seemed to please them (it's a cab stand - they get to rest some more while waiting on their next fare and Italians, if anything, love to rest). My reason for not giving a full five stars is the lack of amenities. I guess you can't have it all, space and services, but there is no fitness center, which you will truly need given the amount of food you'll be eating. And I had some difficulty in getting some laundry done. (We had been on a 10-day cruise before arriving and truly needed some fresh laundry.) The hotel's solution just didn't work for me, but I was able to locate a sweet Italian lady a couple of blocks away who was able to turn around my laundry in about 12 hours. Otherwise, a beautiful hotel with friendly staff - the chamber maids in particular were very sweet. I highly recommend this for a relaxing stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Comfortable, spacious and quiet"”
Reviews.Author: BobClay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Babuino 181 for five nights in July and we loved it. Our good-sized room was nicely furnished, the bed was very comfortable and it was quiet. The spacious bathroom had both a shower and a soaking tub. The walk-in closet and the complimentary Nespresso were nice touches. The location was ideal for first time visitors to Rome like us. Many sites in the historic center are within walking distance (20-30 minutes) and a taxi was always available in the Piazza del Puopolo for longer trips. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful at all times. If I could change one thing about this hotel, it would be the cost, as it was definitely at the top of our price range. But we decided to splurge and we are happy that we did! A total delight!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!!! Great location too!!!”
Reviews.Author: verymary09
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early and was very fortunate to have been checked in. The staff at Babuino 181 made my boyfriend's 40th birthday very special, from booking a private tour of the Vatican to booking a splendid dinner at La Terrazza dell'Eden overlooking all of Rome. The bed was very comfortable and the room was exquisitely designed. We were very close in walking distance to Piazza del Popolo and the trendy boutiques. I can't say enough about this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “the good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: frmrbrit
Reviews.Content: The Good -Nicely located steps from the Hotel de Russie and close to Piazza del Poppolo and the Spanish steps. Room was spacious and well equipped with excellent air conditioning. Comfortable bed. The Bad - no room service or dining room, in fact, with the exception of a small room on the first floor which was under construction and a 4th floor roof terrace which was not open there is nowhere to sit other than your own room. Also soundproofing between floors minimal (people above me sounded like elephants stomping around). Impossible to shower without flooding the bathroom The ugly - the staff tries to be helpful but seems woefully disorganised. My requested wake up call never came due to "a problem with the computer" Only by a miracle did i wake up in time for my first appointment. I had a very busy schedule with only one day in Rome for multiple meetings so ordered a car, giving clear instructions to the receptionist of what time to pick me up at Babuino and all the stops I would be making. Car did not arrive and I discovered it went to my first meeting without me. By the time it came back to pick me up I missed that meeting entirely. We then drove off to the second appointment only to discover driver had been given the wrong address for that and we were twenty minutes in the wrong direction - so two very important meetings lost and a major reason for my trip totally wasted. I would stay here again on vacation when scheduling was not critical but not for a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveller5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our three sons (20, 18 and 12) during the Rome portion of our 25th anniversary trip to Italy. We could not have chosen a better hotel, or a better location, in a better city. The hotel is a boutique-style hotel, near the Piazza del Popolo, and within walking distance to the Spanish steps and the wonderful shops on the Via Condotti. The concierge, Andrea, was outstanding: Professional, friendly, charming, helpful. Recommendations for restaurants were always perfect (which was not always the case during the rest of our trip through Italy). Our suite was wonderful, with contemporary decor, fabulous bathrooms, and a beautiful balcony -- it was perfect to return to such a welcoming (and cool, thanks to the great a/c) atmosphere after our forays during the day, and night. Although the hotel doesn't have some amenities -- restaurant, bar, etc. -- the hotel is in such a great area, with so many good cafes, restaurants, shops, etc., that we never missed them. We can't recommend the Babuino 181 enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, high-spec, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: LukeBrighton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an anniversary trip to Rome which was truly enhanced by our stay at Babuino 181. The hotel is a modern, yet classic, apartment building in a fanstactic location, literally minutes away from the Spanish Steps and other key attractions like the Trevi Fountain. We stayed in the Babuino Suite and, if you get the chance, I would highly recommend it to anyone. It's a very large room with seperate living and bedroom areas, an excellent bathroom with all the mod-cons, and a large private balcony - a real bonus in a city room. The room acted as a complete sanctuary to return to after a day walking the (very hot!) streets of Rome. It was very quiet - we never heard any street noise even though it's in the City centre. Another bonus is the roof terrace which had just opened when we arrived. Echoing the sentiments of other reviewers, the only slight negative is the breakfast which is a little basic, but this really is a minor gripe in an otherwise fantastic boutique hotel. If you get a chance to stay here then do so.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jonathangpr
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Rome and we wanted to stay in a central location(near spanish steps). We were also looking for comfort meaning good size beds and and a large bathroom and we found just that at Babuino 181! The rooms are modern, quiet, and very comfortable and breakfast is served to you right there in the morning. The hotel is very small, which we like, but if you are looking for big hotel amenities you won't find them here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ivoryhorns
Reviews.Content: Was here for a short business trip, had such a pleasant experience at Babuino! They have top notch services and luxury suites. The hotel is also located in a very convenient location. I had an enjoyable stay. It was too bad that I only stayed in for 3 days. Room for improvement would probably be their breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCarol
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation in Barcelona, then took a 10 day cruise, and ended our vacation in Rome for two days. We picked Babuino 181 based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. It is very conveniently located. Rooms are very comfortable and nicely appointed. The bathroom is especially nice and enjoyed the free wifi. The staff is excellent and were very helpful. They told us which metro to use to get where we wanted to go and recommended two restaurants that were both 1/2 block away. After two full days of touring Rome, it was nice to come back to relax in the room and soak in the bath tub! I would definitely stay here again and can recommend it to others. As an added tip, we also used www.RomeCabs.com and www.RomeWalks.com and both were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitz354
Reviews.Content: Had great stay in Rome in this hotel with it's modern beautifully decorated, roomy accommodation. Couldn't better the location. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Plan to return to experience the rooftop terrace and breakfast area that was being built while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: chewiekw
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the staff at Babuino 181 for a great Honeymoon visit to Rome. The restaurants you recommend were perfect little family owned with great food. The staff made us feel like they we were the only ones staying there and helped us make reservations and get to our tours on time. They also help us out with cabs letting us know what we should be paying so that we were not ripped off. Thanks again for a great stay and perfect little hotel in a great location. We look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: GPandSP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, spacious, comfortable, clean and modern! Andrea and the team were extrememy helpful. We would always stay here in the future again and would not bother looking elsewhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate comfort and luxury with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Masie88
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best top hotels we've stayed in. The rooms are large and extremely tastefully designed, providing lots of wardrobe space. The bathroom is large well appointed. The location of the hotel is spot-on. You are in the best street in town, within walking distances to just about anywhere in Rome city. What made it special too was Andrea, the Hotel Manager, who is extremely warm, friendly and helpful. Her staff are equally just as great as Andrea. Breakfast that was delivered to our room was delicious too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: bmfeeley
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night (wish it was longer!! Intend to return) but the location, staff and hotel itself was top notch, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer rooms across street from Hotel De Russie at half the cost”
Reviews.Author: SFownes
Reviews.Content: Beds and pillows fabulous- something overlooked by many European hotels. Bathroom very roomy and clean with real wall mounted shower head. Since hotel is new, everything immaculate. Service was very prompt with breakfast delivered to room both days within five minutes. Location next to De Russie and Piazza Popolo fantastic. Highly recommend for no compromise room comfort.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE FOR MONEY, TOTALLY WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelbug76
Reviews.Content: I'll agree with most reviewers, although last reviewer couldn't be more precise, so I'll just summarize our stay: 1.LOCATION: Superb, posh area, no need for public transportation during our stay, close to very nice restaurants,many only walk distance. 2.ROOM: Very spacious and modern, comfortable. Great bead and linen. Some rooms might face the main street so I guess it will depend on your noise tolerance. We are quite sensitive but it didn't bother us at all.You don't need to pay the big $$$ for places like Hotel di Russie and you get great location, service and comfort. 3.BATHROOM: Great, renovated. Again, I'll agree with last reviewer, it was a challenge to put make up on and also bath tub and sink are a bit impractical. 4.SERVICE: Staff is so attentive, extremely helpful, very professional except for the guy who was on duty late in the evening. They tried to make everything possible for us. Managed to book a Michelin star restaurant after they didn't answer my previous emails. Italian connection, I assume. 5.BREAKFAST: The setting is a bit odd, although you have the option to have it delivered at your room. In our stay the fruit selection was okay, but it did miss a few items that you normally get for breakfast in another top hotels. Bottom line: We would definitely recommend this place and stay again if go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with friendly service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ladyninjitsu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a deluxe room at Babuino 181 for 4 nights in April 2011. We were really relieved to see our room after a very exhausting flight from NY. It was modern, clean and surprisingly spacious. The bathroom was especially large with a soaking tub, separate shower, and separate toilet area. Trust me -- after walking around Rome all day and night, it was like heaven to come back to this room. The hotel also happens to be in the best location as we found it easy to walk to Vatican City and the Ruins/Colosseum. We actually did not need to take a taxi or any public transportation during our stay. We were able to walk to everything! Don't get me wrong...it's not exactly a short walk to these main attractions, but the walks were totally doable and made for great exercise. It probably helped that our room was on the third floor and the windows shut pretty tightly so it kept out most of the noise at night from passersby (we faced the main street). Also note that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant or provide room service but this wasn't a huge deal as there are so many cafes the minute you step outside. We had breakfast and after-dinner drinks at the cafes in the Piazza di Popolo which is literally a couple blocks away from the hotel. So have a negroni or two (or three) and stumble back to the room :) The concierge was super helpful and friendly. They actually advised us on the best way to get to our next destination on our Italy adventure and they went out of their way to reserve a rental car for us. Bottom line: Great boutique hotel and I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and woderful service”
Reviews.Author: Faisal_AlAbdulKarim
Reviews.Content: the location and service in this hotel was great. Even when i had a problem to login the WiFi front desk gave me free of charge laptop to use during my stay. Even better there is a travel agent just nest to the hotel where you can reserve train tickets when you travel to other cities in Italy. In room breakfast gave the stay more convenience and romantice feeling. However, i must admit, the street noise coming from the street is quite loud specially during weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: spdmatos
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great, just a few blocks away from the main attractions in the city center. The restaurant recommendations we got from the reception desk for lunch and dinner were great and the staff was very, very friendly. The only thing that I disliked about the room (they're very spacious and comfortable) is that the windows give to a side street that has a bar and on Saturday night it stays open until 2am and it gets very noisy. Ask for a room that doesn't have a window to this side street.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Philip87
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights over a weekend. As other reviews remark, this is a great hotel. Nice touch is being able to bring your breakfast to your room as breakfast was served on the first floor outside the bedroom door (maybe on other floors as well). Only negative was the front desk was unmanned for about an hour, maybe longer) on Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davlinLech
Reviews.Content: great location, nice rooms. we really enjoyed this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: benrc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, Friday and Saturday - this is my first review as always use trip advisor but never comment! it was great, beautiful room, very spacious, awesome bathroom etc. Little touches like the comfy bed, artwork and cool light switches, made you know this was above average. the best thing was the location, about 5 mins walk from the spanish steps, near the piazza del popolo end of babuino, great spot - so nice to walk up to the villa borghese very easily. service was friendly, although make sure you put the do not disturb sign on, so you dont get woken up during an afternoon sleep! do stay here if you can afford it, is worth the money (and book online on an early bird booking rate like i did from the hotel direct to save - i saved about 30 euros a night doing direct) right, ramble over - enjoy rome

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Europeforever
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfy bed, quiet and clean. Special thanks to Andrea who recommended us the great restaurant Pietro, bar Locarno and helped our stay run smooth and very pleasant. Don't think twice, just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: defrinoj
Reviews.Content: We stayed literally the first week this hotel opened..no one had stayed in the rooms we had...which could have been a disaster, but everything was ready for us and the staff was superb. Andrea, who manages all 3 hotels, greeted us. The rooms are beautiful, on par with the Hotel de Russie but a fraction of the price. Why pay for the common area in a large hotel when you are out on the streets of Rome all day? I did walk down to the De Russie for tea one afternoon, as there is really common area at Babiuno 181. the concierge gave us some great restaurant recommendations and was very professional. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's hard to imagine a better place in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GCD_11
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Rome for many years and have stayed at some of the grand hotels in the center of the city. During this trip with my girlfriend I decided to stay at Babuino 181 since some friends from London that are usually very demanding stayed there and really liked it. The location is just about the best you can find in Rome. The Spanish steps, Piazza del Popolo, Via Condotti, Via Margutta are all minutes away. The hotel has all the amenities of the best five star hotels in Rome and has the intimate feeling of a small palace in the center of the city without the noise and traffic of a bigger hotel. The rooms are extremely comfortable with great bathrooms and the staff goes out of its way to be helpful. Larger five star hotels with rooms of comparable quality (but often smaller) would cost twice as much and would not offer the same feeling. Definitely a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Swair
Reviews.Content: The location is great and walking distance from via del Corso (shopping) and the famous spanish steps! Our stay was pleasurable, the hotel is clean, the rooms are spacious and well organized.

Reviews.Title: “yes yes yes!!!”
Reviews.Author: blablabla30
Reviews.Content: great hotel with great stuff and great manager Andrea!!!! we loved our stay, the location is just perfect, the hotel is brand new, very modern, very clean and very chic!!! we love you Babuino 181!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne538
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastically situated just off the Piazza del Popolo and a short walk to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc. With no restaurant, bar or reception rooms, the hotel feels more like serviced apartments. The contempory-style rooms and suites are superbly furnished and well designed with really well thought out amenities including Nespresso coffee machines and choice of snacks so no problem with the lack of bar/reception. There are no menus but room service come very promptly on calling and breakfast is beautifully presented and excellent quality. There is a twenty-four hour concierge on duty in reception. Those we came across were all extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The staff are all very friendly, modest and charming throughout. The whole atmosphere is modern and chic. The only challenge, no parking closeby so the nearest parking is in the public parking in Borghese if you arrive by car.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service. Wonderful location. Simply perfect.”
Reviews.Author: dubalex
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for the first night of our honeymoon. After traveling for over 20 hours, we were certainly ready for a cozy place to rest in. What we found was beyond our best expectations. We walked in to a bottle of champagne and a personal note, congratulating us on our wedding. This was unexpected and so fun! The room itself was huge! The bed was amazingly comfortable, the view to the street fantastic, and the bathroom to die for. With a huge bathtub and a WONDERFUL shower (and shampoo/wash/lotion etc), we could not have been in a better place to rest up before hitting the town. Upon leaving the hotel to explore for the first time, we were so pleased to see what a fabulous location we were in. Just steps from the (Spanish) steps and a couple blocks from great shopping and restaurants. We hardly had to rely on a map because the people working at the hotel were so wonderfully helpful. We had the good fortune of staying in some nice hotels throughout our 2 week honeymoon and this one certainly stands out. I strongly recommend this to anyone who wants to be able to escape the craze of a big city while wanting to be able to jump right back in after a bit of rest.

Reviews.Title: “We got engaged while staying here - need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: BetsyandJock
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tiny and brand new, in a popular shopping street conveniently near one of Rome's few metro stations. The room was enormous for what we were expecting and the linens, amenities, furniture etc were of an incredibly high standard. (The bath was fantastic!) The staff were full of helpful suggestions regarding genuinely Roman eating options, which we loved. We got engaged on the 3rd day of our 4 day stay here and couldn't have asked for a more beautiful place to come home to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but expensive and with lots of noise at times”
Reviews.Author: vmichailidis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location for shopping, dining and commuting. In fact, after 4 full days in Rome, i would choose this hotel again just for the location. Its 5 minutes walking from piazza de spagnia, metro station and less than 1 minute from piazza del popolo. So when you exit the hotel you are in the middle of all the "action". The drawback is that its not a quiet street. Even with everything shut, the noise is too much for those that want a quiet sleep. Rooms are great (we used the deluxe room which was 330EUR per night). The bathroom is one of the best i have ever seen. But the money is just too much. Staff was very friendly and helpfull at all times and the over all impression was great.

Reviews.Title: “nice design, but lacks comfort”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel as it appeared to be quite charming and well designed, but our stay turned out to be a bit uncomfortable. First thing we noticed in our room was the noise coming from the street – you could easily hear people talking outside, 4 floors down, not to even mention cars and other noises. It literally sounded like our window was open, but it was not. In the morning, we were woken by construction work right below us. I’ve spent hundreds of nights at hotels in loud cities like New York, London, Paris and others, but this was actually the first time I had to switch rooms as I had trouble sleeping. Thankfully, we were able to change to a room located on the courtyard side which proved to be quieter. But even here, I could hear people talking next door, someone taking a shower behind the other wall and heavy footsteps from the room above ours. The AC made a loud humming sound even though it was turned OFF. This sort of noise inevitably takes a toll on the comfort of a hotel room. The breakfast, served in a tiny lounge room, was very limited. White toast, sweet croissaints, random fruit, coffee and water. The hotel is small though, so perhaps it’s understandable. I’m pretty sure we were told it’s served until noon, but on one morning it was cleaned out at 11am. We booked through Tablet Hotels and paid around 300€ a night, which I thought was decent for a boutique hotel. I noticed that their rack rates are €650-850, which is just ludicrously overpriced; €300 is the maximum I would consider paying. Service was good and friendly, design wise the hotel was appealing and the location is excellent. But given the poor soundproofing and crazy price level, I would not recommend staying here unless you get a good rate and can secure a room that is not on the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a gem”
Reviews.Author: NitramGeert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Babuino from Nov. 3 till 11. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome and at home. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Babuino is located ideally close to the Spanish steps, in the heart of Rome's fancy shopping area and with plenty of nice restaurants around. As Rome is a busy and lively city we experienced some street noise at night. It made the Italian feel complete. Andrea and her team did everything to make our stay unforgetable and she runs the place wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Mel13Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a classic suite for 4 nights at the end of September / beginning October. The room is beautifully decorated and the bathroom has to be one of the best in Rome (we have stayed in dozens of Rome hotels). The bedding is fabulous, seating area comfortable and the room size is larger than usual for Rome hotels. We stayed on the 1st floor and overlooked a German bar in the street, it was very noisy at night to about 1-2.00am except for 1 night. Next time we may try a different suite type on a higher floor if possible. Location wise this hotel is fantastic - 1 minutes from Piazza del Popolo and just a few minutes to Piazza di Spagna. It is well situated to walk to St Peters, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. The staff at the hotel were all iincredibly pleasant and friendly, willing to help out with inquiries whenever needed. Thank you to all the staff! We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fabulous bath, and ideal location--but some street noise”
Reviews.Author: tomogo2gether
Reviews.Content: This is a small, personal inn with contemporary decor and modern features in a great location. Wanted to love it and almost did.
