Fabulous room and immaculate bath (soaking tub and separate shower) with many amenities; great location; friendly staff. However, significant evening street noise and a typically hard European mattress made sleeping difficult. Our rate included a nice continental breakfast delivered upon request each morning. They asked what we wanted, but it would have been helpfulif we had been provided with a list of what was available. Still the breakfast was very nice and, most times, promptly delivered. Unfortunately upon arrival found the only outlet in the bathroom broken. Reported it on several occasions over several days to no avail. Finally went down to the desk with wet hair one morning in frustration and got the attention of the manager who was appalled it hadn't been taken care of. Returned that afternoon to a complementary bottle of champagne (nice touch) and a working outlet, but found it odd that when we asked 2 days later the inn didn't have ice available to replenish our champagne bucket . Also washcloths weren't supplied in the bath on the first day (not unusual in Europe), but appeared on Day 2. However, we didn't get them again for the next several days. On our last evening I ran into the housekeeper and requested some, but was told there weren't any available. It was a little thing, but an inconsistency in service I found frustrating for a "luxury" inn. Despite the minor imperfections, would consider returning if another room with less street noise was available or trying one of their other properties where traffic might be less of an issue. P.S. Babuino, consider adding a wall-mounted makeup/shaving mirror to that great bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish room, and sophisticated service delivered with ease”
Reviews.Author: chris_hoskins
Reviews.Content: I had been staying at the Hotel de Russie up the road whilst I was working in Rome but couldn't afford their rates when my wife joined me for the weekend. The hotel is only 50m down the road and the staff where really helpful. We were able to check our bags in at about 11am and they had no problem with us checking out at 1pm on the Monday. Free Wi-Fi (20€ a day up the road). The reception is small but the staff are very, very helpful with everything from restaurant bookings to directions to the local sights. The room itself was a really good size, lovely modern feel, and it easily passed my personal hotel test as the sheets were lovely and the orange juice fresh. Breakfast was very good, nice choice. The first day we ate in our room before we realised that we could just use the little reception area on the first floor right outside our room. We walked to the Coliseum which took about 45mins at a slowish stroll, the Spanish steps are just down the road and it's easy to get to the Vatican. My only issue was that we were on the 1st floor at the front and there was a fair amount of noise. It's a busy shopping street in the day, less so at night when the shops are shut. But being inner city there was an enthusiastic driver tooting his horn at 1am and street cleaning at 4am. The second night (Sunday) was quieter. A bottle or two of water at night would be a nice touch. The hotel were great in organising a car, which knew all the shortcuts and saved us a long wait on the motorway. The cost of this was only 5€ more than a normal taxi. Highly recommended, close to the major tourist locations and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Legitimate 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grnportr
Reviews.Content: The location, property, staff, room...Absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TallTapper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Babuino 181 from October 13-17th of this year. We really like boutique hotels and found this hotel online, read reviews on trip advisor and took a chance. Well, did we find gold! Babuino is incredible! Our room was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was huge and so was the shower stall. The customer service is excellent! Andrea and her staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay enjoyable. We thought that breakfast would be a self serve buffet but there is an attendant to make your coffee, toast and whatever else you want from the selection. He even squeezes fesh orange juice in front of you! We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A new beautiful, modern hotel in Rome with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Bellissimo10
Reviews.Content: We travel to Italy every year and have been looking for a new hotel in Rome. We like to stay in the Piazza del Popolo area and were thrilled to read about Babuino 181 in a review in the NY Times. In fact we had a reservation at another hotel but cancelled it after reading about Babuino 181. From the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice. The service was excellent - particularly Andrea, the Front Office Manager. The room was spacious by Rome standards and was so beautifully designed. The location is fantastic - within walking distance of everything but removed enough from the crowds that gather near the Spanish Steps. The only thing we did not like was leaving. Fortunately we have already made our reservation for next year's trip.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: heidiehlers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very comfortable rooms, very accommodating staff - modern, boutique feeling, gorgeous bathroom, spacious, great location, will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Barrybarry042
Reviews.Content: my wife and I went to Europe from Australia and stayed at this lovely boutique hotel for a week and the choice made our Roman holiday a perfect experience. The front office staff was especially kind and professional and spoke English perfectly (a welcome change in Italy!) and helped us out in planning and enjoying Rome at its best. The suites are top level for beauty and comfort and the location is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Definnitely not luxurious - very, very average!”
Reviews.Author: annetsullivan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, but did not live up to its description as being "luxurious". My room # 203 was small and it seemed shabby - the floor was scuffed, the carpet curled at the edges. The breakfast was not as described - the "diet" breakfast of fruit salad and yoghurt arrived as a whole orange, green banana and an avocado - no yoghurt! Luke warm coffee.

Reviews.Title: “perfect ...”
Reviews.Author: DiegoZapp
Reviews.Content: We got Roma as our final destination in Italy , after been travelling to the south (Napoli, amalfi, Taormina etc) And We pick up The Babuino from internet with out more information... and was wa a incredible choice , the hotel is simple perfect , the location, the services, the room... If you have the chance to take the suite deluxe YOU MUST DO THAT!!! Many thanks to everyone there , You gave us a wonderfull vacation in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property near the Spanish Steps in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EileenGC
Reviews.Content: Great property, the exact mix of comfort, style, intimate size, amenities and an exceptional staff allowed us to thoroughly enjoy the best of Rome (food, shopping and private tours). We appreciate the spacious rooms, incredible location in the center of world-class shopping, restaurants and sites. With its warm contemporary style and modern amenities (from internet to fantastic coffee and pastries), nothing was missed. But the standout of this hotel is the staff, who didn't miss a beat whether arranging private tours of the Roman Forum and Vatican or helping to edit our list of "must-visit" Roman restaurants, they were simply the best concierge service we could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel with a warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cathroma
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed in this lovely boutique hotel just steps from piazza di popolo and the spanish steps to celebrate our anniversary.. the staff were friendly, helpful and gave us excellent suggestions for 2 fabulous restaurants. the rooms were spacious, comfortable sheets (my favorite Frette brand) , comfortable mattress and pillows and on one of the most chic streets in roma.. we had a bottle of chilled champagne waiting in our room from the manager and he personally welcomed us as we checked in.. i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for high quality with a price that was much more affordable than the de russie. we loved our stay at this quaint and delightful hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Service and Staff near the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: chooseytraveler26
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a comfortable, central boutique experience. My 17 year old daughter and i lucked out with the Babuino 181. From the reception staff, Johanes and Fabiana, to the supervisor, Andrea, everyone was ready and willing to give advice on restaurants, destinations, schedules, and transportation. They were incredibly friendly and warm, making us feel that we were home. The rooms were well equipped (coffee in the room and plenty of towels), and all amenities. They helped us buy stamps for post cards, searched and printed out train schedules, called restaurants and helped sort out our cable tv. All with a friendly smile and a courteous hand. I highly recommend it to anyone; families, singles, business people and shoppers. Jennifer and Anjali Saran

Reviews.Title: “Very nice base in Rome - huge rooms with great modern feel - cosy”
Reviews.Author: danieson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights . Loved the front desk team who are so helpful and knowledgeable. Hard to park your car so arrive by taxi . Internet is fast and free. Quality bed and linen. Shower and bath are all like a 5 star hotel standard. Owner seems like he understands what the executive or traveller with luxury standards is after. Simple breakfast only. plenty of food and drink options near by but rome is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “What a great little spot!!”
Reviews.Author: L&JinVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Babuino 181 in early June with not much information to go on and it was such a pleasant treat! The hotel is situated just a few yards from Piazza del Popolo and is in walking distance from all the major historical sites- Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon... Lots of shopping and places to eat and drink all around. Basically, we spent almost four days eating, drinking, and walking. The room was very comfortable and decorated in a modern, Italian style and had some very thoughtful design touches not necessarily found in other hotels. It wasn't a huge room, but it was laid out pretty well. Loved the bed! It was an extremely comfortable, platform bed. The platform framed the matress an extra six or so inches, but it was cushioned so there was no fear of bumping into it. Nespresso coffee maker in the room with a full complement of coffees and teas. Free internet (and it worked!). Mounted flat screen with satellite had Italian channels, so not a lot of English channel choices, but it was fun watching reruns in Italian. Walk-in closet, with motion sensor lights. Light-blocking drapes, to include one for the door. Bathroom was very spacious and very clean. Separate tub and shower. Didn't use the tub, but it looked to be good-sized and it was very clean. The water pressure in the shower was fantastic! The toilet/bidet area had a sliding door to separate from the rest of the bathroom. There were motion sensor lights in the bathroom to act as a nightlight so there was no need to turn on the lights in the middle of the night. That was a nice design touch. Although the hotel is on a busy street, it was surprisingly quiet in the room. We did not hear other guests within the hotel. The staff was really great- they were very attentive and friendly. They arranged our amazing Vatican tour and our car to the airport, as well as some very nice recommendations to local restaurants. There's not much of a lobby as it is very small and there is no seating, so don't expect to hang out there. However, why would we? Small glass elevator takes you to the upper floors. We arranged to have a private Vatican tour, which was organized through the hotel. Four+ hours going through the Vatican museums and getting detailed historical context (and by-passing all the lines)-- it was phenomenal. Perhaps the one area that can use some work is the breakfast. There wasn't much of one. There was food- danishes and minimal choices of fruit, some juice and coffee. Not much choice and it did not seem that appealing. It was also an awkward arrangement, in what seemed a day room. No real table to eat at- a couch and a coffee table. There was no real reason to linger, but that did not affect our overall impression of the hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Babuino 181
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Babuino 181, 00187 Rome, Italy
